intro: Ormosia antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian ormosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. Ormosia antioquensis is often found in humid, forested areas at moderate elevations. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological systems.
